TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed NavigationUIVisibility extends System.Enum

Docs.summary: Specifies whether a displays its navigation chrome. NavigationUIVisibility is used by the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Frame.NavigationUIVisibility%2A> property.

remarks.format:
## Examples The following example shows how always show the navigation chrome of a <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Frame> by setting NavigationUIVisibility to NavigationUIVisibility.
[!code-cs[FrameNavigationUIVisibilitySnippets#SetNavigationUIVisibility](~/add/codesnippet/CSharp/FrameNavigationUIVisibilitySnippets.CSharp/Window1.xaml.cs#setnavigationuivisibility)] [!code-vb[FrameNavigationUIVisibilitySnippets#SetNavigationUIVisibility](~/add/codesnippet/VisualBasic/framenavigationuivisibilitysnippets/window1.xaml.vb#setnavigationuivisibility)] [!code-xml[FrameNavigationUIVisibilitySnippets#SetNavigationUIVisibility](~/add/codesnippet/Xaml/FrameNavigationUIVisibilitySnippets.XAML/Window1.xaml#setnavigationuivisibility)]

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Windows.Navigation.NavigationUIVisibility Automatic = int32(0)

Docs.summary: The navigation chrome is visible when a uses its own journal (see <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Frame.JournalOwnership%2A>).

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Windows.Navigation.NavigationUIVisibility Hidden = int32(2)

Docs.summary: The navigation chrome is not visible.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Windows.Navigation.NavigationUIVisibility Visible = int32(1)
